body: CC: @jbonofre
@iemejia Thank you for the reply, I will take the time to finish it. I reassign the jira to me.

Excellent, there is a big amount of interest on having this one, not only for the improvements but to unblock the removal of Aggregators (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-775). I am eager to have it too to move my work on benchmarks with Nexmark to use metrics.
I will follow the issue and don't hesitate to ping me if you need a hand with something.
I like benchmarks. This is very useful for the performance optimization of sdk and  runners. I'm so glad you can give me some suggestions too.

Tests (especially those with multiple assertions) won't reliably work in the `TestSparkRunner` if that's done, though. This design roughly matches up with my understanding of how we would want to query `PAssert` success metrics, so if we can't support it in Spark we can't really write BEAM-1763 in a runner-independent manner that actually works on all of our runners.
Not with metrics, no. But @bjchambers had an idea for doing this without metrics, but with sideoutput instead.
Yes. I will merge shortly.
retest this please
That's fair. I'll talk to Ben to figure out how to do this with side outputs. I'll submit the bug fix in a different PR.
Thanks!

> I think @XuMingmin has a point here - by adding the "Kafka timestamp" to the KafkaRecord and providing it to the WM function we give users more information

Yes, that is what I am suggesting here short of proper handling of LogAppendTime.  See the caveat below.

>  while still defaulting to a naive "now" WM.

You mean 'curTimestamp'? This policy requires that we should also default 'curTimestamp' to processing timestamp, not kafka record timestamp.

This issue and the one on the interval windows I reported yesterday are part of our ongoing work on recovering Nexmark and getting it to work with all the runners, in case you want to take a look it is here:
https://github.com/iemejia/beam/tree/BEAM-160-nexmark/integration/java/nexmark

It is still a WIP and we will be updating the support matrix as we are chasing the fixes in the different runners (and running our executions).

(As an aside, I'm also going to expect that the target type everywhere except the actual declaration to always be `?` and the input type to be `BoundedWindow` or `?` everywhere.)

Changing to RunnableOnService will cause it to not be picked up by the Apex RunnableOnService execution. That will stop it from breaking in Apex until the actual fix goes in.

Specifically, the Apex RunnableOnService category will not execute any NeedsRunner tests, as it's not configured to pick them up; the test needs to be marked as NeedsRunner or ignored as the SDK doesn't have the proper classes to execute the test in the right context (with a Pipeline Runner)
LGTM modulo Apex ROS tests passing. Please also file a JIRA about this breakage and tag the PR with it.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_RunnableOnService_Apex/845/
--none--

OK, here is what I have done:

 - Rebased to resolve conflicts and fix some later-added `RunnableOnService` tests.
 - Removed `RunnableOnService`
 - Made the poms do the right scan for the category

I have not:

 - Renamed any of the profiles or test executions in the poms
 - Modified the Jenkins job names or invocations

These will require some seed job hackery and I think will be easier to do next.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/8734/
--none--

Separately I will follow up with the website.
I think I'll just drop this since ParDo is not actually *always* translated to ParDo Multi - in Dataflow runner it's not the case, and that makes the current PR more trouble than worth right now.
